option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"I:/GITHUB/ATOTO":"{\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/settings/ThemePrefs.kt\":\"This file contains a single object called `ThemePrefs` that provides a small helper to read and write the selected theme mode (SYSTEM / LIGHT / DARK) using Jetpack DataStore.\\n\\n`ThemePrefs`: Provides a way to manage the theme mode (SYSTEM / LIGHT / DARK) using Jetpack DataStore.\\n\\n`themeFlow(ctx: Context)`: Observes the current theme mode as a Flow, defaulting to SYSTEM if no mode is set.\\n\\n`set(ctx: Context, mode: ThemeMode)`: Persists a new theme mode to the Jetpack DataStore.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/ShizukuCard.kt\":\"This file is a Kotlin code that provides a Composable function called `ShizukuCard` which displays a card with information about the Shizuku app and its installation status, as well as various buttons to interact with the app and related features.\\n\\n`ShizukuCard`: A Composable function that displays a card with information about the Shizuku app and its installation status, and provides buttons to interact with the app and related features.\\n\\n`isInstalled`: A function that checks if a given package is installed on the device.\\n\\n`openShizukuOrPlay`: A function that opens the Shizuku app if it\\u0027s installed, or redirects the user to the Google Play Store to install it.\\n\\n`openUrl`: A function that opens a given URL in the device\\u0027s default web browser.\\n\\n`openDevOptions`: A function that opens the device\\u0027s developer options settings.\\n\\n`openWirelessAdb`: A function that opens the device\\u0027s wireless ADB settings.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/LaunchersCard.kt\":\"This file contains a Composable function called `LaunchersCard` that provides a UI for managing the default home launcher on an Android device. It displays a list of available launchers, allows the user to select a new launcher, and provides options to set the selected launcher as the default or make it a sticky default (with root access).\\n\\n`LaunchersCard`: A Composable function that displays a UI for managing the default home launcher on an Android device.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/ToolkitNav.kt\":\"This file is a Kotlin Compose-based Android application that provides a toolkit for various Android-related tasks. It includes a navigation-based UI with a top app bar, bottom navigation bar, and navigation rail (for wide screens). The file defines the app\\u0027s destinations and their corresponding screens, which include Quick Actions, Launchers, Shizuku, Debloat, Wireless ADB, and Settings.\\n\\n`Dest`: Sealed class that defines the app\\u0027s destinations, each with a route, label, and icon.\\n\\n`ToolkitApp`: The main composable function that sets up the app\\u0027s navigation and UI.\\n\\n`currentLabel`: A helper function that retrieves the label for the current destination.\\n\\n`navigateSingleTopTo`: A helper function that navigates to a specific destination while maintaining the navigation stack.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, dependencies, and build settings for the application. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the Android build process and specifies the dependencies required for the application, including Android Core, Compose, Coroutines, Lifecycle, and DataStore.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/settings/SettingsScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a Compose-based UI for a settings screen that allows the user to select the theme mode (system, light, or dark) for the application.\\n\\n`SettingsScreen`: A composable function that displays the settings screen, including the theme mode options.\\n\\n`ThemeOptionRow`: A composable function that renders a single theme mode option, including a radio button and the option label.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/RootShell.kt\":\"This file contains a utility object called `RootShell` that provides a set of functions to interact with the shell, both with and without root access.\\n\\n`RootShell`: A utility object that provides functions to execute shell commands with and without root access.\\n\\n`isRootAvailable()`: Checks if the device has root access by attempting to execute the `su` command.\\n\\n`runRoot(cmd)`: Executes the given command with root privileges using the `su` command.\\n\\n`runShell(cmd)`: Executes the given command in a normal shell without root privileges.\\n\\n`runSmart(cmd)`: Executes the given command using root privileges if available, otherwise falls back to a normal shell.\\n\\n`exec(argv)`: A private function that executes the given command and returns the exit code and output.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/ui/theme/Theme.kt\":\"This file defines the theme for the ATOTO Toolkit app, which can be set to either a light or dark mode, or automatically follow the system\\u0027s theme.\\n\\n`ThemeMode`: An enum that represents the different theme modes available for the app.\\n\\n`ATOTOToolkitTheme`: A Composable function that sets the app\\u0027s theme based on the provided `ThemeMode`.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app. It does not define any classes or functions, but rather tests the context of the app under test.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Imports necessary Android testing libraries and classes.\\n2. Defines an instrumented test class `ExampleInstrumentedTest` that runs on an Android device.\\n3. Includes a single test method `useAppContext()` that checks if the package name of the app under test matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file is the main entry point for the ATOTO Toolkit Android application. It sets up the application\\u0027s theme based on the user\\u0027s preferences and then launches the `ToolkitApp` composable function.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the ATOTO Toolkit Android application.\\n\\n`onCreate`: Initializes the main activity and sets the content of the application to the `ATOTOToolkitTheme` composable, which applies the user\\u0027s preferred theme to the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/QuickActions.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`QuickActions`: A Composable function that creates a UI widget with quick actions, such as testing the shell and creating a snapshot.\\n\\nThe file provides a tiny widget that can be dropped into an existing UI, allowing users to quickly perform various actions, such as testing the shell and creating a snapshot. The widget displays the root status, provides buttons for the actions, and displays the output of the actions.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary plugins for the Android application and Kotlin Android development.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n2. Applies the Kotlin Android plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/Snapshot.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`makeSnapshot`: This function creates a snapshot of the device\\u0027s state, including system properties and installed packages, and saves it to a directory on the device\\u0027s external storage or internal storage.\\n\\n`runSafe`: This is a helper function used by `makeSnapshot` to safely execute shell commands and handle any errors that may occur.\\n\\nThis file is part of the `atoto_toolkit` package and is designed to work on both emulators (without root access) and physical devices (with root access) using the `RootShell.runSmart()` function. The main purpose of this file is to provide a way to create a backup of the device\\u0027s state, which can be useful for troubleshooting or analysis purposes.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/WirelessAdbCard.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`WirelessAdbCard`: A Composable function that displays a card with information and buttons to enable ADB over Wi-Fi on Android devices.\\n\\nThe file provides a UI component that helps users set up and use ADB (Android Debug Bridge) over Wi-Fi, which can be useful when the Android device is difficult to connect to via USB. It provides instructions and buttons to open the necessary settings on the Android device to enable wireless ADB debugging.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/LauncherUtils.kt\":\"This file contains the `LauncherUtils` object, which provides utility functions for managing the default home launcher app on Android devices.\\n\\n`HomeEntry`: A data class representing an app that can handle the HOME intent.\\n\\n`LauncherUtils`:\\n- `homeCandidates`: Retrieves a list of all apps that can handle the HOME intent.\\n- `currentHomeLabel`: Attempts to get the label of the current default home app.\\n- `openHomePicker`: Opens the system settings screen where the user can choose the default home app.\\n- `promptHomeChooser`: Deprecated, now forwards to `openHomePicker`.\\n- `openHomeSettings`: Opens the home settings page directly.\\n- `setHomeRoot`: Sets the default home app using root permissions.\\n- `makeHomeStickyRoot`: Makes a specific home app the default and optionally disables other home apps.\\n- `forceHomeChooserRoot`: Clears all home role holders, forcing the system chooser to appear.\",\"/app/src/main/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/DebloaterCard.kt\":\"This file appears to be an Android Compose-based UI for a debloater tool. It does not contain any classes, but it does have the following functions:\\n\\n`DebloaterCard`: A Composable function that creates a UI card for the debloater tool, allowing users to search, select, and perform actions (disable, uninstall, restore) on installed packages.\\n\\n`filtered`: A function that filters a list of `PkgItem` based on a search query.\\n\\n`loadPackages`: A suspend function that loads a list of installed packages and their labels.\\n\\n`runPkgs`: A suspend function that runs package management commands (disable, uninstall, restore) on a set of selected packages, logging the results.\\n\\nThe file also defines several sets of package names, including a \\\"protected\\\" set that should not be touched, a \\\"suggested safe\\\" set, and two \\\"profiles\\\" that group packages for different use cases.\",\"/app/src/test/java/dev/eliminater/atoto_toolkit/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file is a unit test class for the `dev.eliminater.atoto_toolkit` package. It contains a single test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 is correct.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A class that contains unit tests for the `dev.eliminater.atoto_toolkit` package.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 is equal to 4.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the project\\u0027s plugin management, dependency resolution, and project structure.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving project dependencies, including Google and Maven Central. It also sets the repositories mode to fail on project-specific repositories.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"ATOTO Toolkit\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module as part of the project.\"}"}
